metadata.title: CVE-2019-3461 on Ubuntu 21.04 (hirsute) - medium.
metadata.description: Debian tmpreaper version 1.6.13+nmu1 has a race condition when doing a (bind) mount via rename() which could result in local privilege escalation. Mounting via rename() could potentially lead to a file being placed elsewhereon the filesystem hierarchy (e.g. /etc/cron.d/) if the directory being cleaned up was on the same physical filesystem. Fixed versions include 1.6.13+nmu1+deb9u1 and 1.6.14.

notes.note: ebarretto> Version on trusty needs the fix, but the fix depends on bind mounts from util-linux package. And the util-linux in trusty doesn't contain that feature. We could use another solution but I am not sure how this might affect the race condition.

criterions.comment: tmpreaper package in hirsute, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1.6.14').
